Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque shopper
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift and am so happy with it!  I love the color of it 1st off and the touch screen makes it so easy to use.  Takes wonderful pictures....I am very pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: cannon powershot
Reviews.Author: powers in virginia
Reviews.Content: this is an awesome camera.  Takes great pics.  I read reviews on dozens before I got this one.  I am very impressed and would recommend.  It is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon users may not realize playback of videos HAS volume control for camera's speakers
Reviews.Author: M. Gehret "G-Man  Colorado"
Reviews.Content: The Elph 500 HS is yet another great camera, with many functions and features left to the users taste.  However, most if not all Canon Powershot and ELPH consumers may not be aware that there is a way to turn up the volume on their playback speaker. Simply touch the screen while your video is playing and while on pause , several icons will appear ,  including the volume control for playback on the camera.  This is not clearly indicated by Canon, but is a tremendous help when playing back on the unit. The Elph 500 is heavy, uses a battery that lasts longer than other camera's in the running .  The 2.0 f stop and movie zoom (using the toggle button) makes for great videos as well as stills. The camera fits in a pocket or purse and offers slow motion, multiple still shots within seconds, HDMI out, and adjustable brightness when shooting in darker situations. A clear winner. No negatives noted. Canon once again provides a professional point and shoot with so much more.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Srinivas Reddy
Reviews.Content: Love the picture quality of this camera.Very handy and the video is absolutely stunning.The HD video quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: Camera works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Timothy M Miler
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, has both touch screen and button controls. We own other Canon cameras, so it's easy to operate for Canon owners.

Reviews.Title: An excellent low light camera with a few unexpected features.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Pantliano "The Photo Guy"
Reviews.Content: The Canon 500 HS is a phenomenal deal for such a capable camera; it's loaded with great features and nice photo quality.Design wise the Canon is fairly stylish and looks like a bar of slightly melted soap.  The brown version is very attractive with a metallic lens barrel and a chocolate brown colored body.  The camera is very small and light and will easily slip into a coat pocket or a small case.  The front of the camera is done in metal, while the rest is plastic.  Still, it's very nicely made and feels solid in the hands.  The only part that feels a bit cheap is the plastic touch screen on the back.  Compared to an iPhone's glass screen it feels low rent.  On the plus side, the tripod socket is metal.In use the 500 HS ranges from fully automated, to almost completely manual.  To change settings you simple flip the switch on the top of the camera.  In automatic mode the camera does all the thinking for you, however, if you want more control you can switch to program mode or one of the many scene and special shooting modes.  One really unexpected and nice feature is the shutter and aperture priority modes.  Very rarely will a camera in this class have these modes, and for the experienced photographer, or those wanting to learn more about photography, these modes are a real plus.  The range for the shutter speeds is 1/1000" - 15", while the apertures range from f/2.0 to f/8.0.Speed wise the Canon 500 HS is very quick to turn on, focus, and take the next photo.  The camera will not slow you down.  It focuses quickly and accurately even in low light on the telephoto end of the zoom, taking about 1" to lock focus.  Switching from playback to picture taking is also quick.  When in playback mode one neat feature is being able to tap the sides of the camera to move back and forth through the photos.Changing settings on the camera is mostly smooth and simple, however the touch screen is not nearly as responsive as an iPhone.  Especially frustrating is trying to negotiate the scrolling menus.  More often than not I overshoot my selection.  Quite honestly I prefer my cameras with buttons, but as far as touch screens are concerned this one is not too bad.  Once you get used to it, you shouldn't have any problems.Photo quality on the 500 HS is very high.  Not only does the camera have an image stabilizer in the lens (which allows for handheld shooting in low light), but it also has an f/2.0 lens at wide angle.  This is a great feature as it lets in a lot more light than cameras that start at f/2.8 (basically the lower the f/ number the more light the camera can collect).  When you combine the bright lens, image stabilizer, and good quality sensor you've got a great camera for taking photos without the flash or when light levels drop.  The 12-megapixel sensor takes images that look good all the way up to ISO 800, and even the highest setting, ISO 3200, can be used in a pinch.  At low ISO speeds the camera takes in a lot of detail and the lens is sharp from corner to corner, even wide open.  Exposure and sharpness are great, however, colors can seem a bit dull at times, especially under florescent lights.Movie quality is also high and taken in high definition with stereo sound.  You can use the optical zoom while filming, and there is a dedicated movie button on the top right hand side of the screen.Battery life is great and I was able to take a few hundred photos with lots of reviewing and a bit of zooming before the battery died.All in all... a really great bargain and a very capable camera.

Reviews.Title: Another great product from Canon
Reviews.Author: Michael Spottiswoode "mspot"
Reviews.Content: So far I haven't used it much but, from my experience so far, it looks like it's another great little product from Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Darrell
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Bought for my wife to take it on a criuse. Pictures are beautiful. Battery does go down quickly. I bought a spare and it was well worth the $$ we paid for it.

Reviews.Author: jimmy c

Reviews.Title: Amazing video quality.  Inconsistent picture quality.  Nice features but needs more buttons.
Reviews.Author: F. Khan
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Amazing 1080p video quality.  Nice list of features and special modes for pics/video. 24mm wide & F/2 lens for $150 is amazing.Cons:  Very inconsistent image quality.  Sometimes perfect shots, other times very grainy, soft images even in situations it should be able to handle.  I personally want more physical buttons instead of a touchscreen that could be more sensitive than it is.  Makes getting around the menus easier.

Reviews.Title: beekeeper
Reviews.Author: Josef W. Ridgway
Reviews.Content: Great camera once all the intricate features are learned.  BUT out of the box it is a valuable tool which takes landscape as well as up close shots with little training.a good buy for a novice as well as a regular user.  Easy to carry and small enough to fit into an protective eyeglass case.  Would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Author: Rae
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month now and love it! It seems like every time I pick it up, I learn something new about it. (I never read manuals) I love the rapid fire shooting as my family is active and the kids don't sit still. I can;t wait to try the firework mode. I've never had a camera that was good for them, but this one has a special setting for them. I love the touch screen and the fact that you can pick what to focus on. The 3" screen is great as well.

Reviews.Title: My New Canon
Reviews.Author: Vic "I never really was into reading books bu...
Reviews.Content: In the past the only digital camera that I would purchase were either HP or Sony. I had always had terrific luck with them and the cost was inline with other cameras of equal equipment. This time although, I felt adventurous I checked into Kodak, Canon mainly As I went through comparing cost and specs and actual abilities of the cameras it became clearly evident the the Canon ELPH 500HS was way out ahead of the rest. I've had long enough to learn some of the perks and one thing I always had problem on my other cameras was freezing fast motion pictures. The two things with Canon that really floored me was 1. The ability to take movies the you intentionally want to slow speed by taking it in a much faster rate. I could take a movie of our overhead fan on high and actually watch the individual blades spin. 2. I also had problems taking stills of sporting events. My nephew is in track and I would always try to take pictures at the finish line. My Canon has a feature where it will take multiple shots and combine them to make the best photo. We live on a hobby farm and this weekend we had the pasture sprayed for weeds. I took several pictures of the airplane diving down over the trees and down to the pasture to spray and it was awesome to catch these shots! I would highly recommend this camera and Amazon who gave me an easy quick platform to order the product and quickly ship it to me.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use compact
Reviews.Author: William Morse
Reviews.Content: Touch screen is very easy to use. Be sure to get a case to prevent marring the screen while carrying. The night shot feature took good pictures without having to use a tripod.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Kathy Breuer
Reviews.Content: The camera came quickly and is exactly what I wanted to replace my other Canon.  The pictures are clear and sharp and the camera is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Novice Camera User
Reviews.Author: Who Knew
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. It's capable of doing lots more than we require for our infrequent camera use, so I can't review a lot of the features, but it's a perfect point and shoot and we're very pleased.  I had a question right after my purchase and the help center at Amazon promptly had my answer.

Reviews.Title: lawry
Reviews.Author: lawry
Reviews.Content: I would give this camera five stars. The only thing it was missing for me is panaramic view. It's good looking, easy to carry and functions great. I also got brownie point for making such a thoughtful choice. I love it. Love the colors it comes in too!

Reviews.Title: Returned After Malfunction
Reviews.Author: S. Wilde
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a gift; I'd had excellent success with an earlier Elph so thought this one would serve the gift recipient in the same way.  Problem was, she could never get it to work right --- the touch screen, both when composing shots and after taking them, showed dark, washed-out images and nothing she or I did remedied the problem.  When the camera did work right one time, it only lasted for about a minute before reverting to the "dark side", including gray vertical lines on the screen.So after we spent hours with the camera, manual, online helps, and solution disc with no success, I arranged with Amazon online to return the camera for a replacement, which is where I couldn't believe the excellent return process.  I followed the online instructions late yesterday afternoon, printed out the bar code sheet, wrapped it and the camera, and early this morning UPS picked the box up;  a new camera has already shipped and is scheduled to arrive first thing next week.I have to believe there's a "short" or something in the electronics and look forward to seeing how the replacement camera works.  I'm giving the camera three stars for now based on the great return process, and will upgrade to four or five if the replacement operates  well.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures!
Reviews.Author: Luckymommy
Reviews.Content: I am a passionate point and shoot picture taker.  I'm the person in the family who drives everyone crazy at every family affair by taking non-stop pictures.  I know absolutely nothing about the technical aspects.  I have not been able to take a decent indoor picture.  I never wanted to go the route of SLR because of the expense and bulk/weight of carrying a big camera.  I have owned Cannon, as well as a Sony, Nikon, Olumpus, and Lumix cameras.  I just started using this camera for Christmas pictures. This camera has provided the nicest indoor flash pictures I have ever taken.  With some of the pictures the flash didn't go off (so far have only used the automatic setting and I haven't had time how to figure out how to force the flash yet) and those pictures turned out very nice!!  Soft and interesting.  The pictures in front of the Christmas tree where the flash didn't go off-probably because of the tree lights-turned out absolutely beautiful!!  I didn't think I would like the touch screen, but it is easy to read and works well.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Judie
Reviews.Content: This was my first digital camera so I was nervous, but this camera is SOOO easy to use. I have always loved Canon's cameras but this one takes pictures that are so clear, they look as if they are 3D. Even takes crystal clear pictures from far away. I would absolutely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Nudrat
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my sister and sent it over to another country . So far she loves it. well may be in a few months, I will know more about it. But so far so good. and very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great photos and video
Reviews.Author: R. Guendoo "flowition"
Reviews.Content: This has become my default use product for photos and video.  It replaced my Canon 790is.  I have been happy with every Canon camera I owned and this is no exception.  The photos and video are awesome quality.  The only knock it the LCD control panel takes a bit getting use to but otherwise I'm sticking with this line.  Powers up fast and very easy to switch between photo and video mode.

Reviews.Title: Awesome lil Camera
Reviews.Author: R. J. Latona "Rosslato"
Reviews.Content: I haven't used this camera much so far but i did some filming in 1080 and was blown away by it's clarity, it's like watching BluRay on your Flat screen Tv. Also love the Touch Screen!

Reviews.Title: Elph 500 rocks!
Reviews.Author: Richard L Jarrell
Reviews.Content: We had a previous lower-end camera of this class, but it was too slow between shots. This camera is simple to use (or has manual modes if you like), but takes outstanding shots. It is ready for follow on shots quickly, and allows specific areas of focus via the touch screen. It also does nice video as well. Buy it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Gartland
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a vacation to Disney World.  I couldn't  have asked for a easier to use camera.  It's very intuitive.  Love the programmed options.  Wish the zoom was a little better, though.  If you're looking for a great, small camera  for vacations, look no further!

Reviews.Title: Canon PS ELPH 500
Reviews.Author: user
Reviews.Content: Its really good..It has some very useful features and I would say its a nice shoot at point camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Gert
Reviews.Content: Needed a good up close camera for ebay items I sell, tried several and this Canon was way better then the 300. I tried other brands and this one was the best! LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera

I also wanted some flexibility and how I use itthis Camera really fits the bill, great pictures and great video's. I am now using it all the time!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for most people

Reviews.Content: I have shot approximately 300 pictures and am well pleased with the quality of the pictures.  I have taken pictures of scenery, people, close-up of flowers and sports. Reviews.Content: I like the touch screen feature very much. Though there are some concern on others' comments regarding insensitive or hard to use its screen, I go ahead bought it any way. Reviews.Author: L. Yeh

I rather have the buttons, since the touch technology can get confused on cycling through menu buttons.

Reviews.Title: A good little P&S; sub-compact...and it better be for the price!

Reviews.Content: Used this new camera a few times.  Takes great pictures, especially in low light (even without using the low-light setting).  It does take some fiddling around with to get used to all the settings.We recently used it a a birthday party (for a little kid) and it does a good job on the "Kids & Pets" setting capturing the kids as they run around.  We took about 180-200 pictures before the battery died, which wasn't great, but apparently on par from what I've read in other reviews.I also got an "Eye-Fi" memory card, which is compatible with this camera--the camera even allows you to turn on/off the wi-fi on the card from the Menu.All in all, a great camera, and I need to play with it more.

Reviews.Title: Nice concept
Reviews.Author: kangfucius
Reviews.Content: Touch screen is lovely but the camera is bulky and the pictures are not as crisp as I would have expected out of a Canon

Reviews.Title: Wife likes it.
Reviews.Author: John Colombero
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife as a Christmas gift.  I did plenty of research and found this to be the best bet for the money.  During the research process only reservations about this camera was that some users seemed to have trouble with the touch screen and complained about the short battery charge.  After taking this into consideration, I felt it was worth the risk considering the alleged advantages - so I bought it.So here's the scoop after 2+ months of use: 1.  Touch screen takes some getting used to, but works fine.  2. Pictures are clear and crisp in optical mode, but digital mode stinks when compared to my 870IS.  3. Outstanding features and awesome view window.  4.  Recharge battery is "so-so."The bottom line is that my wife loves this camera and uses it frequently. Worth every penny as far as I'm concerned. Perfect for her and does the job quite well overall. Cannon nailed a good product for the money here.

Reviews.Title: Beau et performant
Reviews.Author: bobdan19

Reviews.Title: Awful videos
Reviews.Author: Amanda M. Roberts

Reviews.Author: Todd Begin

Reviews.Title: a really great camera
Reviews.Author: George W. Kahl Jr.
Reviews.Content: I wanted a pocket camera that had all the features that I was looking for.Small,feature packed and a fast lens.... I was not disappointed.It takes a bit of a learning curve but the more I used the camera the more comfortable I became.

Reviews.Title: A PUFFED UP LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Ironkitten
Reviews.Content: First off I'm not a professional photographer nor am I a very skilled hobbyist. So I'll skip the technical stuff. I do however; do my research before I buy ANYTHING. I have always owed cannon digital cameras since the early versions of the elph series. I've held on to those way past the boom in megapixels believing more doesn't necessarily mean better. However, since my friend is constantly shooting high quality photos with a Sony Cybershot. I thought it was time to upgrade. (That and my zoom finally broke and was not worth fixing on my SD320)Having an aesthetically and functionally well designed camera is important to me. I really like the weight of this camera. If you want a camera you can slip in your pocket and forget it's there...this isn't it. It's puffed out a bit more that some point and shoots.  And because all its edges are rounded off it's less boxy and yet more aerodynamic looking which feels somehow more sleek and manageable to me. To be picky they could have separated the On/Off button,Trigger button, and the auto buttons farter apart but there's no real problem just again ergonomically not the best choice. The screen is sharp and accurate though hard to see in bright light but no different than most LED. I agree with other review in that the A/V door feels cheap and ready to snap off. It makes me VERY careful when using it.  Finally, the Touch screen: I wasn't sure I was going to like the touch screen since I haven't any other techy touch screens. I was also concerned that sliding around functions requires several frustrating finger taps or unreal pressure. Not the case. I do really like both the touch screen and the tap option for reviewing photos. It may be hard to return to anything but a touch screen camera from now on.Again I bought the camera to step up my ability to shoot higher quality photos for internet posting since I don't print so many pictures any longer. I hope to get more comfortable with manual mode and into less program mode to begin to understand the control of aperture settings. But honestly most of the time I'm point, focus, and shoot. I did look at a whole lot of other cameras the Canon s95 being one. While being lured by the panorama option of a couple of cameras I realized that the novelty of that was not enough to deter me from going for a well designed technically proficient little camera which is what the 500 is. If you're looking for a great little under $300.00 camera that you're proud to pull out when your brother in law fumbles with his honking SLR- this is it.ps:I would advise ordering a nice case for the camera and a decent size SD card at the same time as the big screen seems to scream out PROTECT ME!!! and you will want to run out and shoot 8G of pics

Reviews.Title: POOR. Shutter problems after just 1 week. Amazon....
Reviews.Author: Joe Staiano
Reviews.Content: This Powershot is notorious for having a faulty lens/shutter opening ( it gets stuck).  My previous Canon Powershot Elph had broken lens/shutter opening. It would stick EVERY time the camera was turned on... For EVERY SINGLE photo.  So, I reordered a new Canon Elph from Amazon.  Just 1 WEEK in, the same problem is occurring.  I received the camera 1 day before embarking on a 3-month journey to Africa, India, Nepal.... Sp no way to RETURN to AMAZON.  I hope Amazon Customer Service will still honor a refund / exchange after i return to the states.

Reviews.Title: Slow response while taking pictures
Reviews.Author: A. G.
Reviews.Content: Slow response while taking pictures, but takes good quality videos. Touch screen is clunky (no iPhone quality here!), flash is too small and poorly placed where it gets covered by the fingers most of the time.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as my old camera
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Disappointed as a replacement for my SD850. The pictures are not as sharp and the touch screen seems erratic. The auto mode is unpredictable so that I have to use the P mode to get decent pictures. The picture quality color and sharpness are the most annoying aspects of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Fragile beware
Reviews.Author: S. Li
Reviews.Content: Do you ever drop a camera?  I have.  Many, many times, including many previous Canons.  When I drop my other cameras, they have never broken.  When this camera drops, it is kaput.  The Canon elph 500 lens is more fragile than a saltine; and once broken, it can't be fixed, the entire camera has to be replaced.  I would recommend against this camera for this sole reason.The best things about this camera are the HD videos and the wide angle lens.  If you use more than one camera shooting photos, you'll realize how nice the wide angle lens is.  The HD videos look great.The menus are very different than the old Canons (all touchscreen).  It is very easy to accidentally shoot video, change settings, etc. because it is easy to touch the screen accidentally.  However, this really wasn't as big a pain as it might seem.  The common issue was accidental videos.  The touch screen controls are frustrating at times.  It is much easier to control things with a button than the touch screen.There is no optical viewfinder in this camera which can be an issue at times.  The aperture, shutter speed controls are good, but the presets are a waste of time.  Plus, there is no more "night portrait", which I liked in the old Canons.  The high ISO pictures aren't as poor (grainy) as some people have suggested.All cameras will suffer trauma, and if you don't want to buy a new camera every few months, get another camera.

Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot ELPH 500 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with Full HD Video and Ultra Wide Angle Lens (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Amazing photos
Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: Am still learning to use the many features on this camera.  Takes amazingly clear photos - going from an 8.1 megapixel to a 12.1 makes all the difference in the world!  You certainly can't go wrong purchasing a point and shoot for under $250!

Reviews.Title: Good point-n-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Bonino Simone
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for my wife's birthday about one month ago, and so far we are very satisfied with it. I've a Canon EOS Rebel XSi, and I've to say that some pictures taken with this little thing look almost better than the ones taken with my SLR. Yes, the touch screen is a bit slow at times, but it's actually very enjoyable. Pictures look great in full sun, shade and dark...face recognition does its  job, and you can always select a different point just touching the screen. Very good camera. We haven't used the video capabilities much yet.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: A.H. "AJH"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a week ago to replace my Canon Powershot SD630. So far, I'm very impressed with it. I'm still learning how to use it since it has a whole lot more features than my old camera. I had found the touch screen to be a little lagging, and the screen obviously kept getting smudges. I have recently found that on the camera strap, the little adjuster has one side pointier than the other. I found that the buttons are a whole lot more responsive using that and it solves the problem of a constant smudgy screen. I know Nikon added a pointing stick (or whatever you may call it) on their coolpix touchscreen cameras. Whether Canon intentionally added that pointy side or not, it is a great solution to the sluggish response to the touch. The image quality is very good and I'm enjoying the macro mode and super vivid mode. Overall, it's a great camera and even though I got it for a pretty good price, I still wish it was a little cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with this camera at all.
Reviews.Author: E. Pomeroy "Dad of Three"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this camera, and spent hours upon hours reading product reviews on this camera and others.  I settled on this one due since it was $70 less than the one I really wanted.  Big mistake.I've owned the camera for 3 months now, unfortunately, past the 30 day return window for Amazon.  (Side note: buyer beware...Cameras are a risky buy from Amazon because if your camera doesn't show problems until 31 days later, tough luck for you).  At first, I thought it was a decent camera.  I played with the settings to get more lighting in my dimly lit home, and thought it might be doable.  Well, now that we are in the "dark season" of the year, I'm having problems getting clear shots.  About half of my photos indoors are unfocused, and the camera seems to "stuggle" with focusing, taking precious seconds that make a world of difference when taking shots of children.  It also blurs horribly with children moving (a huge problem for Christmas morning coming up).After a month of use, I noticed the lens cover seemed to have a problem opening and closing.  It's getting worse.  When I turn the camera on, the cover doesn't retract the whole way, so I have to push it in to keep it from blocking the lens.  And when I turn the camera off, the lens has a little gap in the center where it won't close the whole way.  That is a big problem.  How will this camera last without getting scratches and dirt on the lens?  And it's a pain to have to remember to push the cover in so that I can get a quick shot of something unexpected.I also dislike the touch screen.  At first, I liked it.  But I've found it to be unresponsive several times, and it's not old enough to be worn out.  BTW, I don't own any expensive touch screens like iphones that I'm comparing it with, so it's not that I'm some techie snob.Overall, I dislike using this camera for any type of action, including daily children's activities.  So if you want a camera to get pics of your kids, this one is not for you (unless you live outside with natural lighting, because those shots are usually okay).  I also think the touchscreen won't last long enough, and the camera will be useless once it stops working because every function is controlled through the touchscreen.I wish I hadn't bought it, and now I'm out $210 and stuck with a lemon camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Trung Tuan Tran "soonerballa"
Reviews.Content: The camera has some nice features but the picture quality is not as nice as I thought it would be.  I am no expert so I put the camera on auto most of the time and it took some grainy pics.

Reviews.Title: Lacking in Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Isabel
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about getting a new camera with all of todays features, but what a disappointment this camera was.To begin with, the first camera I ordered had a hissing/ringing sound when it was on.  I thought maybe there were other problems that affected the quality, so I ordered a replacement camera and gave it a second chance.  The second one did not have the hissing/ringing sound, but the image quality was no better.  So back it went for a refund!I'm not a photographer.  I don't know much about using manual controls, but I do know a sharp clear image when I see one.  I almost always use the Auto mode and mainly take pictures of my family.  All my comments are on pictures taken in Auto mode using my old Canon SD450 and new Canon 500HS.I have a 4 year old Canon SD450 and it takes sharper images than the 500HS.  At best, maybe out of every 10 pictures, I got one that wasn't extremely soft or blurry, but never really sharp.  Outdoor images didn't compare in clarity or sharpness to the SD450.  Granted, indoor images didn't need the flash in low light and when the flash was used the background was not as dark as with the SD450, but images were always extremely soft in comparison.  After having a camera that takes a really sharp picture, a soft picture is no longer acceptable.I went with a Canon because my SD450 was such a great camera for its time.  I have been reading a lot of reviews now on all kinds of cameras and unfortunately, it seems like all the point and shoot cameras today, although they have a lot of great new features, have actually gone down in picture quality.  If they could make a camera like the SD450 (which was produced at least 4 years ago) take really sharp pictures, why can't they make a point and shoot today that produces a really sharp picture.  It's sad that the camera companies are concentrating on everything but what the original purpose of a camera was--to take pictures!!

Reviews.Author: Xuyang Li
Reviews.Content: The photos taken with this camera are kind of dull.  I bought it because of the f2.0 lens, and the sleek design.  Now I don't quite see the point of having this camera if you have a newer smart phone with a relatively good camera.

Reviews.Title: Not so happy
Reviews.Author: Ganesh Kumar Eswaran "Ganesh Kumar Eswaran"
Reviews.Content: This is my 8th digital camera.  In the last 6 years, I have bought and sold so many digital cameras as I always want the latest model and features.  I usually use the camera for a maximum of 1 year and then sell it and buy a new one.  The only camera that I used for 3 years was Sony DSC P 200.  I sold that bought this Canon camera as I wanted to try Canon for first time.  Unfortunately I did not like it much as the photo quality was poorer than even my old Sony DSC P200.  Even a zoom of 4x appeared very pixelated.  I tried all settings and read the user manual twice to adjust settings.  But still not much improvement.I now have a Sony HX9V and am very very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing: does not outperform smartphone cameras
Reviews.Author: Robbert Patrison
Reviews.Content: Based on the good reviews on Amazon I bought this camera as a present for my wife. We went on a vacation and it seemed a good idea to have a better-quality alternative to smartphones cameras with their tiny optics.  We shot 900+ pictures under various condition using the new camera. We also made a few hundred pictures with the iPhone 4 and 4s, so we could make a fairly objective comparison under various lighting circumstances.The camera looks good and feels well-built. It seemed a worthy successor to our excellent 4MP PowerShot ELPH S400 from 10 years ago. Based on the first impression, we had high expectations of our new top-of-the-line compact camera.Unfortunately the ELPH 500 camera disappointed badly. The picture quality is really poor, essentially ruining our vacation pictures. For most picture types, the ELPH 500 was significantly worse than the iPhone 4s (which has a much smaller lens and 25% fewer pixels). In none of the shots was this camera any better than the iPhone.The main problem is the image quality. Many pictures that our ELPH 500 produced were simply unsharp. The autofocus seemed to misjudge the situation often. Also, the poor focus seemed to be worse on the right half of the picture which might indicate a manufacturing problem unique to our camera. In any case, Canon's quality assurance should have caught this issue. Low light performance was no better than the iPhone, while high-contrast performance was noticeably worse. The only redeeming feature of the ELPH 500 is its optical zoom and stronger flash.The back of the ELPH 500 is a good-looking large LCD touch screen. While the screen quality is great, the touch interface is pretty poor. It does the job, but its a huge step back compared to any smartphone. Most notably are the lack of multi-touch zoom and the inconsistent response to gestures. As the other reviews noted, battery life is inexcusably poor, running empty after about 150 pictures.We are returning this camera back to Amazon. If it doesn't produce significantly better pictures, there is absolutely zero point in owning a dedicated camera that is bigger, more expensive, lacks geotagging and has worse battery life than a smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Wish I had not bought this camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I really wish I had not bought this camera. I've been a fan of the SD line forever it seems. My last one was an SD 1000 and I loved it! So I "upgraded" to the 500HS and regret it very much. The image quality is good - not great but good. The wide angle distorts but is useful, and the video quality is astounding. The pre-programmed modes are really cool, especially the false tilt-shift and low light modes. I love the aperture and shutter value control!Now to the bad points. The door flap for the usb cable feels cheap and it feels like it will break at some point - not such a big deal. The lens makes a slight grinding noise when extending and retracting - annoying and a bit disturbing for a unit like this. The final part - the touch screen is AWFUL. I despise it. It's so hard to get to basic functions and it's very easy to make mistakes. What on earth were they thinking when they came up with that. Really poor design and I hope they either make a huge improvement or eliminate it altogether. I am thinking of getting rid of the camera and going back to some model with mechanical controls.I do not recommend the ELPH 500HS.

Reviews.Title: Horrible image quality
Reviews.Author: Brandon Cannan
Reviews.Content: Used this camera to take around 50 pictures around Christmas.  Almost every picture is blurry and/or washed out.  Could take two pictures in the exact same area with the exact same camera settings and they would turn out completely different.  On top of that, the camera takes forever to focus and actually take a picture.  Canon has apparently gone severely downhill with the quality of their point and shoot cameras.  Already returned.  Stay away from this camera!

Reviews.Title: 1 star for a Canon, Probably way more vs others
Reviews.Author: MaasSql
Reviews.Content: I give this a 1 star because, as a camera, this model fails.  When it flashes, in a dark room, a VERY clear shadow is produced - caused by light from the flash being blocked by the extended lens.  Call me old fashioned, but I think the first thing a camera should do is take clear pictures.  If it doesn't do that ( in every reasonable scenario ), then it fails.The touchscreen is neat!  However.  It seems way too easy to touch, when one is actually trying to take a picture.  That can screw up your whole day.  I, and probably the usability manager for this product, would say that I need some retraining.  Meaning, I don't find this too serious, it's kind of like when we used to drape our fingers over the front of the camera and cover up the lens or flash.  However, it has been a point of frustration.Buy two batteries.  It "seems" to me that I get a low battery, then 'poof' no battery.  Very glad I got a second battery.  Because the price is low, make sure to pick up an extra charger as well.  That way, when you get home from a day of whatever, you can plop both of them in and not worry about switching them out.I have NOT found a great case for this camera.  Reading reviews - the cases are either way too HUGE or just perfect ( the Canon case ).  I guess I'm Goldilocks on that accord.  I find it fits GREAT in my breast pocket, along with the extra battery.Finally, it *sure* *seems* sturdy, like what I've come to expect from Canon.  I've another ELPH here somewhere, that was stolen by my teenagers.  It's taken a licken and kept on ticken, for sure.  I'm certain I'll have this camera for a long while, just have to buy some sort of external flash to make the camera part of it work.

Reviews.Content: I got this camera last night from best buy, and was playing around with it,pro: cool feature, easy to use, light weight, touch screen, smart automode make point and shoot is much more interesting and easier for user.con: died after 1 foot tall drop, so not reliable, I cant believe this camera is so fragile , it wont power on after the incident, i took of my short and drop it on the ground from my chair, and it wont power on, tried to recharge battery and everything but wont work.so disappoint at this.

Reviews.Content: The touch screen does not function easily and causes much frustration. Would never have bought it if I realized this.

Reviews.Title: sbs
Reviews.Author: Simon Shlyayfer
Reviews.Content: I have exactly the same problem as mk. My previous camera was PowerShot G2. I used it for about 10 years - it was a GREAT camera with crystal crisp focus and natural colors. Also it was a true point and shoot, I never needed to use the manual mode for my modest needs. This ELPH is just terrible. I do not know if this is a defect of my device or a generic issue, but right now I certainly would like to return it. I would appreciate your advices and opinions.

Reviews.Content: The instructions are minimal. I struggled to figure out how to open the coverso I could connect to my computer.It uses a nonstandard battery so if you aren't fully charged and the battery dies,hope you brought your charger along and have a nearby electrical outlet. I will neverbuy a camera again that doesn't use normal AA or AAA batteries.
